solution_04_inferential_statistics/03_hypothesis_tests_one_sample/02_hyptest_one_prop_v3

video

We need to calculate the \(p\)-value. \[\begin{aligned} p\text{-value} &= P\left(\big|Z\big| > \frac{\big|\hat{p}-p_0\big|}{\sqrt{\frac{p_0(1-p_0)}{n}}} \right) \\\\ &= P\left(\big|Z\big| > \frac{\big|0.3333-0.5\big|}{\sqrt{\frac{(0.5)(0.5)}{24}}} \right) \\\\ &= P\left(\big|Z\big| > 1.6333198 \right) \\\\ &= 0.1024018 \end{aligned}\]

Of course you could have rounded the \(z\) score. Either of the following will also get credit.

\[p\text{-value} ~=~ \left(\big|Z\big| > -1.64 \right) ~=~ 0.101\] \[p\text{-value} ~=~ \left(\big|Z\big| > -1.63 \right) ~=~ 0.1032\]


  1. 0.1024018
  2. FALSE / TRUE
